intro: Pimelea linoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed waratah, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bright red or orange flowers that resemble a crown. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, giving it a grass-like appearance, while its stems are often woody and branched. It is a hardy shrub that can thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
